content: Rachel Maddow [""""url=http://www.towleroad.com/2009/05/18year-decorated-air-force-veteran-to-be-discharged-for-being-gay.html]http://www.towleroad.com/2009/...d-for-being-gay.html[/url] reports on Decorated Lt. Colonel Victor Fehrenbach, an F-15 fighter pilot and 18-year veteran of the Air Force. He is ready to deply again, but the military is firing him under "Don't Ask, Don't Tell", two years short of being able to retire with full pension benefits. Servicemember's Legal Deffense Network executive director Aubrey Sarvis writes: "Lieutenant Colonel Victor J. Fehrenbach, a fighter weapons systems officer, has been flying the F-15E Strike Eagle since 1998. He has flown numerous missions against Taliban and al-Qaida targets, including the longest combat mission in his squadron's history. On that infamous September 11, 2001, Lt. Col. Fehrenbach was handpicked to fly sorties above the nation's capital. Later he flew combat missions in Iraq and Afghanistan. He has received at least 30 awards and decorations including nine air medals, one of them for heroism, as well as campaign medals for Kosovo, Afghanistan, and Iraq. He is now a flight instructor in Idaho, where he has passed on his skills to more than 300 future Navy, Marine Corps, and Air Force weapons systems officers. Since 1987, when Fehrenbach entered Notre Dame on a full Air Force ROTC scholarship, the government has invested twenty-five million dollars in training and equipping him to serve his country, which he has done with what anyone would agree was great distinction. He comes from a military family. His father was a retired Air Force lieutenant colonel, his mother an Air Force nurse and captain. Lt. Col. Fehrenbach has honored that tradition." A $25 million dollar investment. The military is throwing it away over his sexuality. Said Fehrenbach to Maddow: "About 4,000 people are assigned to Mountain Home Air Force Base, and only about 10 people on the entire base even knew of my case up until this very moment. Those were my immediate chain of command, a couple of attorneys in the legal office, and a couple of officers in the Office of Special Investigations. Not one single person that I'm assigned with in my squadron, or that I fly with in my fighter squadron, knew about this case until this moment." Watch the video: [""""url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8NZDRjEKwtQ&feature=player_embedded]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v...ture=player_embedded[/url] This message has been edited. Last edited by: mainedawg, Wed 20 May 2009 04:05 PM

content: I’d be the first to agree that this is just not right no matter how you slice it. Perhaps it would help, if not now but in the long run, if all of us call and send email to the president and our respective congress critters and strongly voice our outrage. Don’t ever underestimate the power in numbers and if our numbers are loud and frequent enough then it will be noticed.
reply: I’d be the first to agree that this is just not right no matter how you slice it. Perhaps it would help, if not now but in the long run, if all of us call and send email to the president and our respective congress critters and strongly voice our outrage. Don’t ever underestimate the power in numbers and if our numbers are loud and frequent enough then it will be noticed.
title: Military Boots 18-Year Air Force Pilot

content: It's long past due, That we go back in time to a speach by then, Pres. John Keneddy who stated something in the line of. Don't ask what this country can do for you, But what you can do for this country. This LC has laid his life on the line, for the good old USA, for 18 years, Been hand picked, to fly missions,In the defense of the USA, kept his personal life out of site, for all of those years. Then we turn around and watch him booted out. Not fair ,right or proper. Let him continue to serve or give him his earned right of retirement , With all the full honors earned. LC please keep fighting for every one this policy affects, that are in ,And don't show or talk. This act is not fair. This act is just a bad as the old Racial devide's that our proud darker skinned American's had to endure durning WW 2, When many showed, They where just as good, and in many cases sometimes better, ONE, such case as the Black pilot unit who flew combat in that war. Where is the true difference? In a fighter plane, It's still the same solid BRASS chops as any one else, White,Black, Yellow or Red, Male or Female. If that man or women wants and is willing to serve, keep what, or how they belive, behind closed doors. Let them. We all stand = while proudly wearing a uniform of this grand country.

LC please keep fighting for every one this policy affects, that are in ,And don't show or talk. This act is not fair. Where is the true difference? In a fighter plane, It's still the same solid BRASS chops as any one else, White,Black, Yellow or Red, Male or Female. If that man or women wants and is willing to serve, keep what, or how they belive, behind closed doors. Let them. We all stand = while proudly wearing a uniform of this grand country.
title: Military Boots 18-Year Air Force Pilot

content: It's interesting what no one is willing to talk about: the circumstances that led to the investigation a year ago. Popping positive on an HIV test, maybe? A lot of heterosexuals have been booted out of the military, often by way of Ft. Leavenworth, for indulging in their sexual preferences off-duty. You not only have to be good at your job, you also have to conduct yourself at all times as an officer or a gentleman.
reply: It's interesting what no one is willing to talk about: the circumstances that led to the investigation a year ago. Popping positive on an HIV test, maybe? A lot of heterosexuals have been booted out of the military, often by way of Ft. Leavenworth, for indulging in their sexual preferences off-duty. You not only have to be good at your job, you also have to conduct yourself at all times as an officer or a gentleman.
title: Military Boots 18-Year Air Force Pilot

content: quote: Originally posted by buckdani: It's interesting what no one is willing to talk about: the circumstances that led to the investigation a year ago. Popping positive on an HIV test, maybe? You're making a very touchy comment there, buddy. Substantiate that insinuation or retract it. There's not a SHRED of evidence that HIV had anything to do with this discharge. Not a single mention of HIV or AIDS in any article about this pilot. You're pulling stuff out of your backside, and it smells.
quote: Originally posted by buckdani: It's interesting what no one is willing to talk about: the circumstances that led to the investigation a year ago. Popping positive on an HIV test, maybe?

content: quote: Originally posted by buckdani: It's interesting what no one is willing to talk about: the circumstances that led to the investigation a year ago. Popping positive on an HIV test, maybe? A lot of heterosexuals have been booted out of the military, often by way of Ft. Leavenworth, for indulging in their sexual preferences off-duty. You not only have to be good at your job, you also have to conduct yourself at all times as an officer or a gentleman. HIV is not a disqualifier, believe it or not. Thousands of people with HIV, many of them straight, serve in all four branches of the military. In the Air Force they can even serve overseas. Aside form that, your transparent attempt to cast aspersions on the man through unsubstantiated claims is disgusting and less than honorable - in other words, par for the course from opponents of equality.

Aside form that, your transparent attempt to cast aspersions on the man through unsubstantiated claims is disgusting and less than honorable - in other words, par for the course from opponents of equality.

content: Gay local Air Force officer plans to fight discharge from service Air Force Lt. Col. Victor Fehrenbach, a decorated military weapons systems officer who grew up in the Dayton area, is being recommended for discharge after 18 years of service for homosexual conduct, an Air Force spokesperson said. The move has made Fehrenbach, who was born at Wright-Patterson Air Force Base and graduated from Wayne High School in Huber Heights, a face on the controversial Don’t Ask, Don’t Tell policy for gay military personnel because of his high rank and distinguished career. “Victor is a great human face that shows the problem that is ‘Don’t ask, Don’t Tell.’ This is happening every day,” said Kevin Nix, spokesman for the Servicemembers Legal Defense Network, a national non-profit organization that is providing Fehrenbach with free legal counsel. Fehrenbach, 39, an assistant director of operations for the 366th Operations Support Squadron at Mountain Home Air Force Base in Idaho, said Wednesday, May 27, that he was outed by a civilian acquaintance. More at ... >>>http://www.daytondailynews.com/news/dayton-news/gay-local-air-force-officer-plans-to-fight-discharge-from-service-136024.html
reply: Gay local Air Force officer plans to fight discharge from service Air Force Lt. Col. Victor Fehrenbach, a decorated military weapons systems officer who grew up in the Dayton area, is being recommended for discharge after 18 years of service for homosexual conduct, an Air Force spokesperson said. The move has made Fehrenbach, who was born at Wright-Patterson Air Force Base and graduated from Wayne High School in Huber Heights, a face on the controversial Don’t Ask, Don’t Tell policy for gay military personnel because of his high rank and distinguished career. “Victor is a great human face that shows the problem that is ‘Don’t ask, Don’t Tell.’ This is happening every day,” said Kevin Nix, spokesman for the Servicemembers Legal Defense Network, a national non-profit organization that is providing Fehrenbach with free legal counsel. Fehrenbach, 39, an assistant director of operations for the 366th Operations Support Squadron at Mountain Home Air Force Base in Idaho, said Wednesday, May 27, that he was outed by a civilian acquaintance. More at ... >>>http://www.daytondailynews.com/news/dayton-news/gay-local-air-force-officer-plans-to-fight-discharge-from-service-136024.html
title: Military Boots 18-Year Air Force Pilot

content: "I will fight this in uniform and I'll fight it without," Fehrenbach said. "I swore an oath to defend and support the Constitution, I'm going to speak out and fight this until the law is repealed because it is not constitutional." He said "don't ask, don't tell" denies American service members their constitutional right to privacy, due process and equal protection, and forces them to lie about who they are when honesty is part of the code they serve under. 9 Air Medals! Freakin Homo~Sapien! He is an American Hero!!!!! I Dont Care What Orientation He Is!!!! You Have My Support, Sir! AWildEagle26 Semper Fidelis
reply: "I will fight this in uniform and I'll fight it without," Fehrenbach said. "I swore an oath to defend and support the Constitution, I'm going to speak out and fight this until the law is repealed because it is not constitutional." He said "don't ask, don't tell" denies American service members their constitutional right to privacy, due process and equal protection, and forces them to lie about who they are when honesty is part of the code they serve under. 9 Air Medals! Freakin Homo~Sapien! He is an American Hero!!!!! I Dont Care What Orientation He Is!!!! You Have My Support, Sir! AWildEagle26 Semper Fidelis

He comes from a military family. His father was a retired Air Force lieutenant colonel, his mother an Air Force nurse and captain. Lt. Col. Fehrenbach has honored that tradition." A $25 million dollar investment. The military is throwing it away over his sexuality. Said Fehrenbach to Maddow: "About 4,000 people are assigned to Mountain Home Air Force Base, and only about 10 people on the entire base even knew of my case up until this very moment. Those were my immediate chain of command, a couple of attorneys in the legal office, and a couple of officers in the Office of Special Investigations. Not one single person that I'm assigned with in my squadron, or that I fly with in my fighter squadron, knew about this case until this moment." Watch the video: [""""url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8NZDRjEKwtQ&feature=player_embedded]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v...ture=player_embedded[/url] This sux! all our fine troops are of course heroic but Lieutenant Colonel Victor J. Fehrenbach is a cut above. He has given and given and now a lousy two years from full retirement the nation that he has laid his life on the line is for time after time is going to toss him in the crapper. Please tell me again, why am I so effin patriotic? This message has been edited. Last edited by: mainedawg, Wed 20 May 2009 04:06 PM

content: I’d be the first to agree that this is just not right no matter how you slice it. Perhaps it would help, if not now but in the long run, if all of us call and send email to the president and our respective congress critters and strongly voice our outrage. Don’t ever underestimate the power in numbers and if our numbers are loud and frequent enough then it will be noticed.

content: It's long past due, That we go back in time to a speach by then, Pres. John Keneddy who stated something in the line of. Don't ask what this country can do for you, But what you can do for this country. This LC has laid his life on the line, for the good old USA, for 18 years, Been hand picked, to fly missions,In the defense of the USA, kept his personal life out of site, for all of those years. Then we turn around and watch him booted out. Not fair ,right or proper. Let him continue to serve or give him his earned right of retirement , With all the full honors earned. LC please keep fighting for every one this policy affects, that are in ,And don't show or talk. This act is not fair. This act is just a bad as the old Racial devide's that our proud darker skinned American's had to endure durning WW 2, When many showed, They where just as good, and in many cases sometimes better, ONE, such case as the Black pilot unit who flew combat in that war. Where is the true difference? In a fighter plane, It's still the same solid BRASS chops as any one else, White,Black, Yellow or Red, Male or Female. If that man or women wants and is willing to serve, keep what, or how they belive, behind closed doors. Let them. We all stand = while proudly wearing a uniform of this grand country.

content: It's interesting what no one is willing to talk about: the circumstances that led to the investigation a year ago. Popping positive on an HIV test, maybe? A lot of heterosexuals have been booted out of the military, often by way of Ft. Leavenworth, for indulging in their sexual preferences off-duty. You not only have to be good at your job, you also have to conduct yourself at all times as an officer or a gentleman.
reply: It's interesting what no one is willing to talk about: the circumstances that led to the investigation a year ago. Popping positive on an HIV test, maybe? A lot of heterosexuals have been booted out of the military, often by way of Ft. Leavenworth, for indulging in their sexual preferences off-duty. You not only have to be good at your job, you also have to conduct yourself at all times as an officer or a gentleman.
title: Military Boots 18-Year Air Force Pilot

content: quote: Originally posted by buckdani: It's interesting what no one is willing to talk about: the circumstances that led to the investigation a year ago. Popping positive on an HIV test, maybe? You're making a very touchy comment there, buddy. Substantiate that insinuation or retract it. There's not a SHRED of evidence that HIV had anything to do with this discharge. Not a single mention of HIV or AIDS in any article about this pilot. You're pulling stuff out of your backside, and it smells.
quote: Originally posted by buckdani: It's interesting what no one is willing to talk about: the circumstances that led to the investigation a year ago. Popping positive on an HIV test, maybe?

Not a single mention of HIV or AIDS in any article about this pilot. You're pulling stuff out of your backside, and it smells.

content: quote: Originally posted by buckdani: It's interesting what no one is willing to talk about: the circumstances that led to the investigation a year ago. Popping positive on an HIV test, maybe? A lot of heterosexuals have been booted out of the military, often by way of Ft. Leavenworth, for indulging in their sexual preferences off-duty. You not only have to be good at your job, you also have to conduct yourself at all times as an officer or a gentleman. HIV is not a disqualifier, believe it or not. Thousands of people with HIV, many of them straight, serve in all four branches of the military. In the Air Force they can even serve overseas. Aside form that, your transparent attempt to cast aspersions on the man through unsubstantiated claims is disgusting and less than honorable - in other words, par for the course from opponents of equality.

Aside form that, your transparent attempt to cast aspersions on the man through unsubstantiated claims is disgusting and less than honorable - in other words, par for the course from opponents of equality.

content: Gay local Air Force officer plans to fight discharge from service Air Force Lt. Col. Victor Fehrenbach, a decorated military weapons systems officer who grew up in the Dayton area, is being recommended for discharge after 18 years of service for homosexual conduct, an Air Force spokesperson said. The move has made Fehrenbach, who was born at Wright-Patterson Air Force Base and graduated from Wayne High School in Huber Heights, a face on the controversial Don’t Ask, Don’t Tell policy for gay military personnel because of his high rank and distinguished career. “Victor is a great human face that shows the problem that is ‘Don’t ask, Don’t Tell.’ This is happening every day,” said Kevin Nix, spokesman for the Servicemembers Legal Defense Network, a national non-profit organization that is providing Fehrenbach with free legal counsel. Fehrenbach, 39, an assistant director of operations for the 366th Operations Support Squadron at Mountain Home Air Force Base in Idaho, said Wednesday, May 27, that he was outed by a civilian acquaintance. More at ... >>>http://www.daytondailynews.com/news/dayton-news/gay-local-air-force-officer-plans-to-fight-discharge-from-service-136024.html
reply: Gay local Air Force officer plans to fight discharge from service Air Force Lt. Col. The move has made Fehrenbach, who was born at Wright-Patterson Air Force Base and graduated from Wayne High School in Huber Heights, a face on the controversial Don’t Ask, Don’t Tell policy for gay military personnel because of his high rank and distinguished career. “Victor is a great human face that shows the problem that is ‘Don’t ask, Don’t Tell.’ This is happening every day,” said Kevin Nix, spokesman for the Servicemembers Legal Defense Network, a national non-profit organization that is providing Fehrenbach with free legal counsel. Fehrenbach, 39, an assistant director of operations for the 366th Operations Support Squadron at Mountain Home Air Force Base in Idaho, said Wednesday, May 27, that he was outed by a civilian acquaintance. More at ... >>>http://www.daytondailynews.com/news/dayton-news/gay-local-air-force-officer-plans-to-fight-discharge-from-service-136024.html
title: Military Boots 18-Year Air Force Pilot

content: "I will fight this in uniform and I'll fight it without," Fehrenbach said. "I swore an oath to defend and support the Constitution, I'm going to speak out and fight this until the law is repealed because it is not constitutional." He said "don't ask, don't tell" denies American service members their constitutional right to privacy, due process and equal protection, and forces them to lie about who they are when honesty is part of the code they serve under. 9 Air Medals! Freakin Homo~Sapien! He is an American Hero!!!!! I Dont Care What Orientation He Is!!!! You Have My Support, Sir! AWildEagle26 Semper Fidelis

content: Rachel Maddow [""""url=http://www.towleroad.com/2009/05/18year-decorated-air-force-veteran-to-be-discharged-for-being-gay.html]http://www.towleroad.com/2009/...d-for-being-gay.html[/url] reports on Decorated Lt. Colonel Victor Fehrenbach, an F-15 fighter pilot and 18-year veteran of the Air Force. He is ready to deply again, but the military is firing him under "Don't Ask, Don't Tell", two years short of being able to retire with full pension benefits. Servicemember's Legal Deffense Network executive director Aubrey Sarvis writes: "Lieutenant Colonel Victor J. Fehrenbach, a fighter weapons systems officer, has been flying the F-15E Strike Eagle since 1998. He has flown numerous missions against Taliban and al-Qaida targets, including the longest combat mission in his squadron's history. On that infamous September 11, 2001, Lt. Col. Fehrenbach was handpicked to fly sorties above the nation's capital. Later he flew combat missions in Iraq and Afghanistan. He has received at least 30 awards and decorations including nine air medals, one of them for heroism, as well as campaign medals for Kosovo, Afghanistan, and Iraq. He is now a flight instructor in Idaho, where he has passed on his skills to more than 300 future Navy, Marine Corps, and Air Force weapons systems officers. Since 1987, when Fehrenbach entered Notre Dame on a full Air Force ROTC scholarship, the government has invested twenty-five million dollars in training and equipping him to serve his country, which he has done with what anyone would agree was great distinction. He comes from a military family. His father was a retired Air Force lieutenant colonel, his mother an Air Force nurse and captain. Lt. Col. Fehrenbach has honored that tradition." A $25 million dollar investment. The military is throwing it away over his sexuality. Said Fehrenbach to Maddow: "About 4,000 people are assigned to Mountain Home Air Force Base, and only about 10 people on the entire base even knew of my case up until this very moment. Those were my immediate chain of command, a couple of attorneys in the legal office, and a couple of officers in the Office of Special Investigations. Not one single person that I'm assigned with in my squadron, or that I fly with in my fighter squadron, knew about this case until this moment." Watch the video: [""""url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8NZDRjEKwtQ&feature=player_embedded]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v...ture=player_embedded[/url] This message has been edited. Last edited by: mainedawg, Wed 20 May 2009 04:05 PM
reply: Rachel Maddow [""""url=http://www.towleroad.com/2009/05/18year-decorated-air-force-veteran-to-be-discharged-for-being-gay.html]http://www.towleroad.com/2009/...d-for-being-gay.html[/url] reports on Decorated Lt. He has received at least 30 awards and decorations including nine air medals, one of them for heroism, as well as campaign medals for Kosovo, Afghanistan, and Iraq. He is now a flight instructor in Idaho, where he has passed on his skills to more than 300 future Navy, Marine Corps, and Air Force weapons systems officers. Since 1987, when Fehrenbach entered Notre Dame on a full Air Force ROTC scholarship, the government has invested twenty-five million dollars in training and equipping him to serve his country, which he has done with what anyone would agree was great distinction. He comes from a military family. His father was a retired Air Force lieutenant colonel, his mother an Air Force nurse and captain. Lt. Col. Fehrenbach has honored that tradition." A $25 million dollar investment. The military is throwing it away over his sexuality. Said Fehrenbach to Maddow: "About 4,000 people are assigned to Mountain Home Air Force Base, and only about 10 people on the entire base even knew of my case up until this very moment. Those were my immediate chain of command, a couple of attorneys in the legal office, and a couple of officers in the Office of Special Investigations. Not one single person that I'm assigned with in my squadron, or that I fly with in my fighter squadron, knew about this case until this moment." Watch the video: [""""url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8NZDRjEKwtQ&feature=player_embedded]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v...ture=player_embedded[/url] This message has been edited. Last edited by: mainedawg, Wed 20 May 2009 04:05 PM

This act is just a bad as the old Racial devide's that our proud darker skinned American's had to endure durning WW 2, When many showed, They where just as good, and in many cases sometimes better, ONE, such case as the Black pilot unit who flew combat in that war. Where is the true difference? In a fighter plane, It's still the same solid BRASS chops as any one else, White,Black, Yellow or Red, Male or Female. If that man or women wants and is willing to serve, keep what, or how they belive, behind closed doors. Let them. We all stand = while proudly wearing a uniform of this grand country.
title: Military Boots 18-Year Air Force Pilot

content: It's interesting what no one is willing to talk about: the circumstances that led to the investigation a year ago. Popping positive on an HIV test, maybe? A lot of heterosexuals have been booted out of the military, often by way of Ft. Leavenworth, for indulging in their sexual preferences off-duty. You not only have to be good at your job, you also have to conduct yourself at all times as an officer or a gentleman.

content: Gay local Air Force officer plans to fight discharge from service Air Force Lt. Col. Victor Fehrenbach, a decorated military weapons systems officer who grew up in the Dayton area, is being recommended for discharge after 18 years of service for homosexual conduct, an Air Force spokesperson said. The move has made Fehrenbach, who was born at Wright-Patterson Air Force Base and graduated from Wayne High School in Huber Heights, a face on the controversial Don’t Ask, Don’t Tell policy for gay military personnel because of his high rank and distinguished career. “Victor is a great human face that shows the problem that is ‘Don’t ask, Don’t Tell.’ This is happening every day,” said Kevin Nix, spokesman for the Servicemembers Legal Defense Network, a national non-profit organization that is providing Fehrenbach with free legal counsel. Fehrenbach, 39, an assistant director of operations for the 366th Operations Support Squadron at Mountain Home Air Force Base in Idaho, said Wednesday, May 27, that he was outed by a civilian acquaintance. More at ... >>>http://www.daytondailynews.com/news/dayton-news/gay-local-air-force-officer-plans-to-fight-discharge-from-service-136024.html

content: "I will fight this in uniform and I'll fight it without," Fehrenbach said. "I swore an oath to defend and support the Constitution, I'm going to speak out and fight this until the law is repealed because it is not constitutional." He said "don't ask, don't tell" denies American service members their constitutional right to privacy, due process and equal protection, and forces them to lie about who they are when honesty is part of the code they serve under. 9 Air Medals! Freakin Homo~Sapien! He is an American Hero!!!!! I Dont Care What Orientation He Is!!!! You Have My Support, Sir! AWildEagle26 Semper Fidelis
